programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the Old Man try to buy one of America's most valuable race cars - a 1965 Shelby Cobra - and become interested in a clock from a Second World War ship.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A banner from the secret WWII airborne division The Flying Tigers flies into the shop. Plus, Chum gets his hands on a 1980s Ooze-it toy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Nazi Weird War Two
programme.desc: Robert Joe and Sam Willis explore Heinrich Himmler's Wewelsburg Castle, to discover why he tries to destroy it and the secrets behind the infamous Black Sun room.

programme.title: Nazi Weird War Two
programme.desc: How a collection of art treasures found in an Italian castle at the end of the Second World War were stolen and somehow survived being stored on the front line.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Tensions rise between the members of one team, resulting in a terrible accident. A young swamper defies his father, while another makes a reckless decision.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie and his crew struggle to rescue a trailer from a dangerous bridge. Plus, a crash involving many vehicles proves deadly for a Good Samaritan. Documentary following the work of a heavy rescue team patroling the roads of Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a whiskey flask said to have belonged to an American Civil War spy, two 19th-century English duelling pistols and the contract for the Who's appearance at Woodstock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers meet a man selling a home-made mortar that fires bowling balls. They also examine a ticket from a 1965 contest between boxers Muhammad Ali and Floyd Patterson, and an antique spotlight from the 1930s.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts explore the disappearance of civilisations throughout time and across the globe, wondering if clues left in their wake point to an otherwordly explanation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine the link between aliens and the Civil War, exploring Abraham Lincoln's strange visions and ghostly images seen at Gettysburg.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked with creating a signature Damascus blade out of three different steels of different thicknesses. The two final competitors re-create one of the most intricate weapons in history - the steel crossbow..

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Three Kennys Are Worse Than None
programme.desc: Paul's brother Barry must make sure his standards are high when he is asked to fill in for Paul and Bogart at an auction in Brampton.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy decides to bring his young nephew and protege to experience the highs and lows of an auction in South Etobicoke.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit rural Minnesota, where they meet antiques collectors and examine vintage peep show machines.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle search through a scrapyard and a 19th-century ghost town, and find a classic car with a famous Hollywood history.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find what seems to be a dinosaur bone, and ask the curators of the Museum of Natural Science to verify whether or not it is real.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers bargain over a Colt revolver, a coffee machine, presidential pins and a spinning wheel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers inspect a 1965 Chevrolet Impala, meet a man hoping to sell a 1775 Massachusetts war bond, and examine a classic 1946 Seeburg jukebox.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars get their hands on a cast member's script from James Bond classic Goldfinger and are tempted by a 10th anniversary edition Datsun ZX and a Civil War stamp..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers investigate a huge gold bar thought to be from a 14th-century shipwreck, and consider a collection of baseball memorabilia in mint condition.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The brokers come across top-secret maps and plans for the Second World War battle of Iwo Jima. Additional items include a 1967 Ford F-100 truck.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a classic 1967 Rokon Trailbreaker motorbike and a collection of rare Muhammad Ali memorabilia. They also have to decide whether a 1715 Escudo Spanish gold coin is a fake.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get hold of the first-ever issue of Playboy, which featured pictures of Marilyn Monroe, and examine an engraved whale's tooth that could be a piece of scrimshaw from the 19th century.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine an edition of Dante's Inferno that dates back hundreds of years. They also consider an antique serpent-shaped sword and the rights to photographs of Michael Jackson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the opportunity to purchase a speakeasy gaming wheel, a hand-crank corn-sheller from the 1900s and a coin believed to be from George Washington's funeral.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers consider a 1939 Second World War plane, an 1812 munitions receipt signed by future president Andrew Jackson and two life-size cowboy mannequins.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Northern Ireland, and the lads kick off in Belfast, home to the SS Titanic - and a treasure trove of maritime memorabilia. In Cavan, Ian bids for some Croke Park turnstiles, before they see a recreation of a traditional rural Irish home in Ulster.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Specialists in the field of the extraterrestrial study evidence across 75 million years to validate the theory that there has been extraterrestrial intervention on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at a theory that suggests aliens may have colonised an ice-free Antarctica, before a global event plunged it into the Ice Age.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: When a diver gets tangled in the wreck and another line compromises the propeller, Tim suits up and dives into harm's way, but Martin quarrels over the location of the gold chamber.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: After suffering a casualty, the Knights Templar prepare to exact revenge. De Nogaret faces some of his greatest challenges while Landry and Talus come to an understanding on Knightfall. Part-fictionalised drama, starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A wannabe singer drags his underperforming backing dancer into court and Romesh arbitrates on a long-running food feud between Gogglebox stars Sandi and Sandra.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Two warring naturist cleaners dress for court in their birthday suits, and a disgruntled claimant is seeking damages for his broken drum.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News For You
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with Scottish Convervatives leader Ruth Davidson MSP and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: An evening of comedy at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Ventriloquist Nina Conti comperes the event, with a little help from her monkey, before introducing routines by stand-up stars Rob Beckett and Jimeoin.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: James Acaster, Kate Williams, Ed Balls and Lauren Laverne join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: A therapist is convinced that Josh has been infatuated with her for a long time, while Kate tries to get her photography career off the ground.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: Best of Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: A compilation of the best karts, crashes and costumes from the most recent Red Bull Soapbox action from around the world.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's travels take him along the Canal Lateral a la Garonne, where he goes fishing for shad, and is invited to attend a barbecue lunch. He also investigates the produce on offer at Nerac's local market, and joins the villagers of Bruch for a snail dish.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge excursion through south-west France, visiting the city of Agen and tasting the first melon of the season in Quercy before cooking the famous Gascon dish poule au pot.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a road trip, trying to follow the path of the Three Wise Men across the Middle East. However, they opt to do so in open-top sports cars that were built for significantly less demanding tasks than driving along the conflict-ridden mountains of southern Turkey, through war-ravaged Iraq and across the searing deserts of Syria. The trio also try to find out what myrrh is and where it can be bought.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Highlights of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain - with distinctly mixed results.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Memorable moments of ineptitude; a convertible minivan; James May tries to drive up an Icelandic volcano.

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Richard Hammond scours the Top Gear archives to relive the team's attempt to cross the English Channel in home-made amphibious cars.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: Best of Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: A compilation of the best karts, crashes and costumes from the most recent Red Bull Soapbox action from around the world.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites actor Ross Kemp, singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor and comedian Rob Beckett to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares to the depths of Room 101 for ever. Their gripes include misplaced clapping, teeth, expensive water in hotel rooms and snobby shop assistants.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Kaiser Chiefs' frontman Ricky Wilson, and comedians Joe Lycett and Zoe Lyons to express their anger over people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include new towels, escalators and the bartender at the local pub.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy attends a three-day trade conference to drum up business, but when she has little luck she resorts to flirting with the male delegates. Lee is outraged with her plan, however, and in an attempt to stop her he turns up at the event - posing as her husband. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites David O'Doherty, Rose Matafeo and Ed Gamble to help him make sense of the world.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Field Marshal Montgomery's daring airborne plan to end the war by Christmas, which went a bridge too far at Arnhem.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: The lives of some of history's most iconic kings and queens. Tracy Borman explores Queen Victoria's relationship with her husband and her eldest son.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring China's wildlife continues with a journey to the Yunnan Province, where parallel mountain ranges channel mighty rivers from Tibet southward to the tropics, and the landscape provides a home to diverse species. While the mountain forests are home to red pandas, the valleys below contain jungles inhabited by gibbons, sunbirds and elephants.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Wildlife living on the Tibetan plateau - an inhospitable area the size of western Europe - including brown bears, yaks, giant sheep, snow leopards and the chiru or Tibetan antelope.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The series concludes with a visit to the country's eastern seaboard to investigate how the Chinese government is managing environmental concerns while meeting the ever-expanding needs of the population. Among the region's diverse locales lie futuristic cities, seaweed-thatched villages and rugged wetlands that are home to some of the world's rarest animal species.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring China's wildlife continues with a journey to the Yunnan Province, where parallel mountain ranges channel mighty rivers from Tibet southward to the tropics, and the landscape provides a home to diverse species. While the mountain forests are home to red pandas, the valleys below contain jungles inhabited by gibbons, sunbirds and elephants.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Wildlife living on the Tibetan plateau - an inhospitable area the size of western Europe - including brown bears, yaks, giant sheep, snow leopards and the chiru or Tibetan antelope.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The series concludes with a visit to the country's eastern seaboard to investigate how the Chinese government is managing environmental concerns while meeting the ever-expanding needs of the population. Among the region's diverse locales lie futuristic cities, seaweed-thatched villages and rugged wetlands that are home to some of the world's rarest animal species.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the decade's psychedelic music, featuring counter-culture classics by the Who, Pink Floyd, Joe Cocker, the Nice and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: The late 1960s saw the first regular transmission of colour television, and the music world followed the trend with the launch of BBC television show Colour Me Pop. This episode features some of the programme's highlights, including performances by the Who, the Kinks, the Small Faces, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the supergroups and guitar heroes to emerge toward the end of the decade, including Pink Floyd, the Rolling Stones, Fleetwood Mac and Jimi Hendrix.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Who, Queen, David Bowie, the Moody Blues, the Rolling Stones and Elton John.

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part two of two. Experts analyse the Princess's marriage to Lord Snowdon at the start of the 1960s. At home with celebrities and artists, they're riding the wave of a cultural and sexual revolution that's transforming Britain. The mystique of monarchy is being increasingly undermined by the emergence of a more open and egalitarian society.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Knights of the Garter arrive at Windsor Castle for their annual lunch with members of the monarchy, which includes a complicated procession through the palace. The royal archives allow cameras to view nearly 200 years of photo albums, including the thousands of photographs from the Queen Mother's collection, and the castle clock-maker faces a race to ensure all 450 timepieces on the estate are turned back.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn visits the Ffestiniog in North Wales originally built to transport slate from mountain to coast and learns about Amsterdam Centraal.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A zombie movie being filmed on the island ends in real-life horror when a stand-in is poisoned - and new detective inspector Humphrey soon deduces that the unfortunate victim was not the killer's intended target. He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina is reprimanded by Amanda Prosser for her drunken behaviour, but redeems herself by devising an impressive new initiative against antisocial behaviour. Ben Meadows pleads guilty to dealing drugs and agrees to provide information on all his contacts, while Amber is entrusted with the delicate task of telling a mother her son has been killed in an accident - but manages to get the wrong woman.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Bradley outlines his cost-cutting plans for the hospital, dividing opinions among the staff, especially when he suggests they could perform more operations to earn a £3million bonus. Joseph returns to the wards, but it is clear his OCD is not under control when he insists on scrubbing his hands repeatedly and fumbles a simple procedure.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tina visits Australia to look for Sean - but her search leads her into the scorching heat of the Outback, where she soon realises finding him will be more difficult than anticipated. Back in England, the winter flu crisis stretches Charlie and his staff to the limit. Medical drama, starring Claire Goose, Gerald Kyd and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ricky is put in charge of Janine's party, Ian embarrasses Kathy in front of Phil and Michelle confesses to Pauline.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Most TV characters are incapable of straying very far from their native haunts without either finding romance or stumbling over a murder and Dr Finlay is no exception. Here, his much-needed Highland walking holiday ends in the former, but it still turns out to be pretty hectic. David Rintoul stars.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A woman becomes convinced she has contracted syphilis from her husband, who indignantly claims he has never had an affair - raising suspicions that she is the one who has been unfaithful. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques expert stumbles on what seems to be a bargain in Frankie's scrap yard in the shape of an iron cannon. Though convinced his luck must finally have changed, problems lie ahead when the item attracts the attention of a devious major. Tongue-in-cheek drama, with Ian McShane and guest star Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Ram-raiders destroy a valuable Sheraton desk and steal what they haven't broken, forcing the roguish dealer to scout around for new stock. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer gets involved in a con at a country house involving the sale of a fake painting in exchange for a parcel of diamonds. However, Lovejoy later realises he too has been set up over the deal. Richard Griffiths guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard Poole meets up with a group of old university friends who have arrived on the island for a reunion, only for tragedy to strike when the man who has solved so many murders becomes the victim. Faced with such a sensitive crime, the commissioner quickly drafts in another British inspector to help the team get to the bottom of the mystery. It soon becomes clear that the newcomer, Humphrey Goodman, is just as eccentric as Poole - but he is also just as bright, and wastes no time questioning the partygoers, all of whom are prime suspects, while pondering the biggest mystery of all - how did the culprit commit the crime in full view of all the other guests? Kris Marshall joins the cast, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A zombie movie being filmed on the island ends in real-life horror when a stand-in is poisoned - and new detective inspector Humphrey soon deduces that the unfortunate victim was not the killer's intended target. He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and the team are called upon to investigate the death of Fidel's old school friend, Carlton Paris, who has been shot at home. The victim was last seen alive at an art gallery with Dorothy Foster, a wealthy older woman - and before long they discover he made his living as an escort and had left several disgruntled and heartbroken women in his wake, including a local judge and the wife of a club owner. But as the investigation progresses, Fidel struggles to keep his emotions in check, forcing him to confront some long-buried issues. Kris Marshall and Gary Carr star, with guest appearances from Adrian Scarborough, Sharon Small, Tristan Gemmill and Josette Simon.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A flight attendant is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island's commerce minister is shot dead in his home, and with the incident coming shortly after the exposure of a scandalous affair - not to mention a suicide note at the scene - it looks like an open-and-shut case. But Humphrey isn't convinced and believes someone else was responsible for the killing, whittling down the possible suspects to leave his betrayed wife, his son and his mistress in the frame. The rest of the team struggles to see past the physical evidence, which still suggests he took his own life - and then matters are complicated even further when Camille gets a blast from the past.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. The victim was one of a group of enthusiasts who had visited the island for a glimpse of a famous parrot - but the team soon faces a conundrum as all the suspects were in full sight of one another when the crime was committed. As the cops search for answers, they uncover evidence of long-standing rivalries, secret jealousies and romantic entanglements. But would any of it justify killing a harmless ornithologist?.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Darkness Before The Dawn - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A constable is shot in a botched raid on an opium den led by Watts, and Murdoch suspects John is being framed for murder by Inspector McWorthy.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: The Man with the Golden Gun
programme.desc: Humphrey and his colleagues are called to a neighbouring private island whose property developer owner has been shot dead at a family gathering. Five people are in the frame - the victim's housekeeper, his PA and his three children - although when an approaching hurricane strands the cops on the island, knocking out the phones and computers, they are forced to rely on good old-fashioned investigative techniques. As evening approaches, the cops realise they will be spending the night in a house with a killer. Can they solve the mystery before he or she strikes again? Jimmy Akingbola (Holby's Antoine Malick) and Nikki Amuka-Bird (Luther) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Goodman is called in to investigate the death of former surgeon Emma Redding at a retirement home. With an empty packet of sleeping pills beside her body and her room locked from the inside, it looks like an open-and-shut case of suicide. However, the team discovers everything is not as it seems and mounting evidence suggests she may in fact have been poisoned. Then, a blast from Humphrey's past arrives unexpectedly on the island, and looks set to distract him from solving the case. Guest starring Rupert Vansittart, Joanna David, Phil Davis and Michele Dotrice.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Back on the murder squad, Pat is asked to investigate when a young mother of two, Diane Leach, is abducted from a local wood. The confession of a local sex offender complicates matters, as Pat looks into the possibility that the father of a young protege of the woman may be responsible for her disappearance. Meanwhile, Walker has worries of his own, as his ex-wife Lyn is dating an abusive, unstable man, who turns into a manic-obsessive when she decides to leave him.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Ian King Live
programme.desc: All the day's business news live from Sky's City of London studio, with Ian King.

programme.title: Coronavirus: America's Reckoning
programme.desc: In this compelling documentary, Sky News Correspondent Cordelia Lynch explores the humbling impact of coronavirus on the most powerful country on earth.

programme.title: Coronavirus: The Home Front
programme.desc: Alex Crawford returns to the UK to report on the impact of coronavirus through the eyes of a hospital and town in the north west of England.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: A young woman's murder is murdered in the vicinity of a library and museum owned by a wealthy philanthropist with an interest in global mysticism. It's a complicated investigation, which leads the detectives into a world of mysticism, erotica, drug addiction and tempestuous family dynamics. But as if the case were not enough to contend with, Van der Valk also finds himself fending off office gossip about himself and his newly single colleague Lucienne. Marc Warren stars as the shred Dutch detective, with Maimie McCoy and Luke Allen-Gale.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel steps up to acting DI on a case that becomes bigger and more sinister than it first seemed. Meanwhile, Janet is glad of Rachel's return, having not known how much she was going to need her friend. Starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's on a trip to Translovenia and takes shelter in a mansion owned by a vampire. In reality, this vampire is just Weasel..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: A bear has escaped from the zoo and Fizz is hell-bent on making it his pet. Magoo mistakes the bear for his niece who's come to spend the day with him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Fizz for his best friend Harry from school, and thinks the two of them are visiting their old school..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: It's Iris's birthday and Mike wants to surprise her with a special party. Balloons, gifts, Piñata - the works!.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: While Mike prepares a special sushi dinner to win Iris's heart, the racoons break into the garage intent on creating some mischief.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler tries his hand at DIY plumbing. Voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The bumbling buffoon decides that acquiring some pets could liven up his dull existence. Animated comedy, with the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: During a family cookout at a forest campsite, Charmcaster users her magic to switch places with Gwen.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Squishy Predicament of Stanley Peet's Stinky Pits
programme.desc: Animation. George and Harold enlist Stanley Peet to help win the 'avocadgrow' contest..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: It's the biggest sporting event in Grimsby - the bog roll roll. All Dave has to do is chase the bog roll down the hill and catch it..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds don't care about a carbon footprint, since George has come home with a haul of free electronics that they all want to test out..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef presents more highlights from the series, prepares a meal for Craig Revel Horwood, and offers tips on preparing mussels, rice pudding and steak bearnaise. Plus, recipes from Thomasina Miers, Frances Atkins and Galton Blackiston.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by chef Galton Blackiston for a tour of Cornwall. They sample some world-class ice cream before visiting Newlyn fish market to buy cod, which James cooks with oysters and tartare sauce. The trip concludes with a visit to Sennen beach, where they practice their oil painting and break out the barbecue.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Seville in southern Spain, starting at a convent where the nuns sell home-made sweets to visitors - a tradition that goes back 400 years. He also learns about iberico ham from deli owner Elio, and hooks up with local cookery teacher Ana to learn a few traditional recipes, before tour guide Lola takes him for a boating at the Plaza De Espana. Along the way, he rustles up a charred orange and spiced almond salad, a Spanish pork sandwich and a tapas selection.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a new garden for an eight-year-old girl in Nottingham, despite the worst weather they have ever experienced. Tilly Sawford was severely scalded in a freak accident six years ago and continues to require treatment to aid her recovery, leading to the staff at her local hospital recommending the family have a safe garden created for them, with a bold colour scheme and surprise areas for all of the children.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Peterborough, where Alys Dobbie deals with a cheeky seller, Tony Geering has to dig deep in an attempt to secure an item and Simon Schneider is hoping he will not have to pay a mint for a gold coin.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five police colleagues calling themselves Cop a Load of Us answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Alan Davies, Sally Phillips and Dr Ranj Singh to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which they must answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1979 FA Cup Final - Arsenal v Man Utd - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester United. Gabriel Clarke introduces coverage of the 1979 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which featured the likes of Pat Jennings and Liam Brady for the Gunners, and Joe Jordan and Jimmy Greenhoff for United. With commentary from Brian Moore and Brian Clough.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the semi-final of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK. With brand new obstacles to face, the course is more extreme than ever, as the best competitors from four heats return to fight it out for a place in the final.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hits the road one last time for the concluding installment in this second series of the open-air game show. Once again, Stephen is hitting the streets in a city somewhere in the UK, and setting the members of the public he meets along the way a succession of unusual challenges. Success in these games could give the contestants a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to a £1000 cash prize in the big finale game. This week, Stephen's final destination is Belfast.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts a revival of the classic game show. Today's panellists are Danny Dyer, Sally Phillips and Chris Kamara, who visit three mystery celebrity homes, and are challenged to guess the identities of the famous occupants.

programme.title: Gangster Squad (2013)
programme.desc: A New York gangster brings his criminal organisation to Los Angeles in 1949, rapidly seizing control of the city's criminal activity and corrupting the authorities to ensure no one stands up to him. The chief of police discreetly sets up a secret task force with the intention of bringing the mobster to justice. Crime thriller, starring Josh Brolin, Ryan Gosling and Sean Penn.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in turning trees into matches, and how chrome is polished to make it shiny.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team takes on an antique plate camera, a dilapidated piece of designer furniture and a violin that spent the Second World War in Auschwitz concentration camp.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr and his father finally settle the lawsuit that has pulled their family apart, and OCC builds a rock 'n' roll-themed bike for Hard Rock.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: Five of the world's most impressive trucks are pitted against one another in a variety of key categories.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike helps to erect a radio communications tower - not a task for the faint-hearted - before heading to Hollywood to celebrate his work in all 50 American states with a song.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope, including traditional Basque ham and chisteras.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope as the manufacture of objects including asphalt pavers and basque espadrilles are analysed.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Sig tries to offload his crab before saving his gear, Casey shows Josh what it means to be a captain, and the polar ice descends, threatening the end of the season.

programme.title: Devonport: Inside the Royal Navy
programme.desc: The crew on board HMS Protector go through First Officers Sea Training, and Devonport's Field Gun Team competition from fierce rivals - HMS Raleigh's Royal Marines.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work on an old VW camper van, changing the exhaust and completing a diesel service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work on the camper van is completed, and the finished article proves very popular when it is snapped up by a buyer straight away.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China try to breathe new life into an old VW Beetle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The VW Beetle begins to take shape as auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and expert mechanic Edd China continue their restoration, but things do not go according to plan.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer settles for a Volkswagen T2 panel van after his budget proves too tight for a classic Camper, and mechanic Edd China agrees to ambitious plans concerning its renovation.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants to splash the cash on a custom bus, but mechanic Edd China favours a more conservative campervan due to him being an air-cooling expert. the two settle for a VW Split-Screen.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sources a 181 Thing from a collector, but is forced to dig deep for the purchase, meaning there is not much money left in the kitty for Edd China's repair job.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is ecstatic when he snaps up a cult VW Corrado coupe with only one previous owner for a bargain price - but with cheap cars come expensive surprises.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to prove he can make money on a car without spending a fortune, while Edd China turns his attention to restoring a Mercedes-Benz SLK on a very tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China are asked to restore a powerful, luxury 1983 Mercedes 500 SEC, but face a steady challenge in returning it to its former glory.

programme.title: Swimming with Monsters with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist travels to the sea of Cortez to study and swim with the voracious Humboldt squid - but risks being dragged into the abyss by its deadly tentacles.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate for a find, the Bushmen gamble on a dangerous mining method deep below ground. In Lightning Ridge an injury causes The Bros a serious setback.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike takes on a Porsche 924, the first car he ever turned around on the series, but oil leaks and a worn interior may not be enough to earn a profit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland take on their biggest restoration yet, a VW Beetle Karmann Cabriolet. The car is in terrible condition, but Drew is determined to save it from the scrapheap.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard road trips to Cornwall for a major buying mission. In Penzance, he haggles with a hoarder who owns a reclamation yard, before heading to the county's busiest auction house.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a toy fire engine, a Japanese Imari bowl that has been smashed to bits, and a unique village sign from Dorset.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part two of two. Henry Cole continues to ride his Harley Davidson through the South Island. His route takes him through primeval forests and picturesque west coast towns such as Greymouth.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate for a find, the Bushmen gamble on a dangerous mining method deep below ground. In Lightning Ridge an injury causes The Bros a serious setback.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: On Valentines' Day 2007, police in Southern California were called to a particularly violent murder scene. Advances in forensic genealogy finally solved the case.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How serial killers increase their chances of being caught with each murder they commit, due to the forensic evidence which is unavoidably left at the scene.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Christie Wilson. When she disappeared after a night out, CCTV cameras caught her gambling with a mysterious man. detectives hoped the footage would unlock the secrets of what had happened to her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The July 1999 murders of Diana Algar and her friend Jose Molina. Three letters scrawled across Algar's living room wall offered a key clue in a US-wide manhunt. Two drifters who Auger had allowed to lodge in her Pennsylvania home were later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of a hunting accident that turned into a murder-for-hire plot when a tip linked a teen's murder to a man who killed his friends for a fee.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A dog suffers a panic attack that causes its body temperature to rise to dangerous levels, and the team rescues cats living in squalor.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to treat a puppy born with a cleft palate, and receives a call from worried lifeguards when snakes hit the beach.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a family dog with life-threatening heat stroke, and a terrier with a fear of skateboards. He also needs to collect some alligator saliva.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tamika tries to stay within her budget on the hunt for a gown, while Ashley finds the perfect princess dress, but the price may be a little too high.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride comes in for alterations to her dress, while Camille and Randy take up the challenge of creating a flattering look for a customer.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A dress fitting becomes a bittersweet moment, while a customer looks for a gown that shows off her curves.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: The surgical team tries to help a porpoise that has been left blind by a cataract.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown operates on a dog with a large mass hanging from its back leg.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to treat a puppy born with a cleft palate, and receives a call from worried lifeguards when snakes hit the beach.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a family dog with life-threatening heat stroke, and a terrier with a fear of skateboards. He also needs to collect some alligator saliva.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Jeanne fears she'll never get the weight-loss surgery she needs as she faces challenges from her parents. Plus, an unexpected death sets her back.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. A woman who has spent 10 years in bed turns to a doctor for help with losing weight, but may have left it too late to change.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lupe has been in hospital for two months, and must lose 75 pounds before surgery is possible. However, her doctor fears her husband is a bad influence.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Cameras observe the model, businesswoman and celebrity's life in an access-all-areas pass into her relationships with family and friends, at work and at play.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Saralyn is in need of two dresses to share her wedding with her sister, and Rachel brings her sibling to help her make a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kara wants a red dress for her big day, but her future mother-in-law has more traditional ideas. Meanwhile, Sheena needs a gown for her Indian wedding reception.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Dina searches for a dress that is as sassy as she is. Meanwhile, Laure wants a simple lace gown for her big day, but the people around her have different ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Precious looks for a gown to suit her new body following weight-loss surgery, while Stefanie wants a simple dress, but her family has other ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Not What I Had in Mind
programme.desc: Broadway dancer LaQuet is looking for a fun dress with straps to cover her arms as she walks down the aisle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Emily, a lawyer by day and rock singer by night, wants to contrast her normal all-black style with a traditional lace wedding gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The death of the fiance's mother makes bride-to-be Amanda's dress fitting tough, as the consultant also knew the deceased and they had all planned to be present at the ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'll Know It When I See It
programme.desc: Brooke is looking for a special gown - it has to be unique and she won't settle for anything else. Unfortunately, nothing seemingly lives up to her expectations.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa conducts a group reading on a passenger cruise ship, and with no escape from the spirits on board she faces being able to read a lot of people.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo invites Victoria's boyfriend's parents over, but her daughter is anxious that her mum will perform a reading.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo hosts a drumming circle to ease the stress of her busy schedule in the hope of being able to compose herself.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Featuring a woman whose hoarding has alienated her family and threatened her marriage, and another whose collecting habit has reached crisis point.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of Angela, who fell in love soon after joining a dating site. A first date seemed to trouble her, and when she went out for a second time, she never returned.

programme.title: Surviving Evil
programme.desc: True crime tales of those who survived traumatic attacks. This edition recalls the horrific story of a woman who was kidnapped and raped in front of her children.

programme.title: Serial Psyche
programme.desc: Experts examine the backgrounds of some of history's most notorious serial killers. They explore the crimes and psychology of Peter Sutcliffe and Jeffrey Dahmer..
